This warming relationship, marked by expanded engagement beyond traditional areas, is drawing attention amid regional tensions and strategic shifts.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/appreciate-anti-terror-effort-us-secretary-of-state-marco-rubio-wishes-pakistan-on-independence-hails-trade-ties/articleshow/123293175.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/appreciate-anti-terror-effort-us-secretary-of-state-marco-rubio-wishes-pakistan-on-independence-hails-trade-ties/articleshow/123293175.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 08:24:36 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="36574" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123293436,imgsize-36574.cms"/></item><item><title>Rajasthan Royals ask for Jadeja or Ruturaj in swap deal for Sanju Samson</title><description><![CDATA[Sanju Samson's future with Rajasthan Royals is uncertain as the franchise explores trade possibilities, with owner Manoj Badale leading discussions with other IPL teams. RR reportedly approached Chennai Super Kings, expressing interest in Ravindra Jadeja or Ruturaj Gaikwad in exchange for Samson, but CSK is unwilling to release these key players.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-trade-rajasthan-royals-ask-for-ravindra-jadeja-or-ruturaj-gaikwad-in-swap-deal-for-sanju-samson/articleshow/123293496.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-trade-rajasthan-royals-ask-for-ravindra-jadeja-or-ruturaj-gaikwad-in-swap-deal-for-sanju-samson/articleshow/123293496.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 08:27:03 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1391959" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123293643,imgsize-1391959.cms"/></item><item><title>Delhi-NCR wakes to heavy showers: Streets waterlogged, traffic crawls</title><description><![CDATA[Delhi and NCR experienced heavy rainfall, leading to waterlogging and traffic disruptions in several areas. The weather is expected to intensify from August 14 to 17, with increased rainfall and humidity. Authorities have cautioned commuters about potential congestion, especially around ceremonial routes, advising them to take precautions during this wet spell.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/heavy-rain-hits-delhi-ncr-ahead-of-independence-day-triggers-waterlogging-and-traffic-disruptions-in-several-areas/articleshow/123293561.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/heavy-rain-hits-delhi-ncr-ahead-of-independence-day-triggers-waterlogging-and-traffic-disruptions-in-several-areas/articleshow/123293561.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 08:32:47 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI CITY DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1256155" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123293724,imgsize-1256155.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

      <title><![CDATA[India-China direct flights resumption likely to boost trade, tourism and economic ties]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/aviation/india-china-flights-resumption-economic-ties-impact-19653647.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[India and China are set to resume direct passenger flights after five years, a move expected to boost trade, tourism, and economic ties. The resumption comes amid growing diplomatic engagement, recent trade approvals, and ahead of Prime Minister Modi’s visit to China for the SCO Summit. Pre-pandemic, over 8 lakh passengers traveled annually between the two countries, with cargo flows also significant. Restoring direct flights is likely to reignite strong demand, supporting business, tourism, and people-to-people exchanges.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Wed, 13 Aug 2025 23:52:07 +0530]]></pubDate>
      <dc:creator>Swapnil Deshpande</dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/aviation/india-china-flights-resumption-economic-ties-impact-19653647.htm]]></guid>
      <category><![CDATA[Business]]></category>
      <media:content height="675" width="1200" medium="image" url="https://images.cnbctv18.com/uploads/2024/03/china-india.jpg"/>
    </item>

    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Pilot poaching: Is India's request valid?]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/aviation/pilot-poaching-is-indias-request-valid-19653640.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[On average in India, a senior First Officer earns about ₹5 lakh a month. At Emirates or Etihad, it’s ₹10 lakh rupees, tax-free, plus free housing and free schooling for up to 3 children. In the US, the same job can get you ₹17 lakh a month. That's almost two and a half times what they get in India.]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[Dashverse, an AI-driven entertainment startup, is set to invest 60-70% of its recent $13 million Series A funding into advanced AI research and development. With its microdrama app Dashreels surpassing 5 million downloads in just a month and ranking third on the Google Play Store, the company aims to build India’s leading AI creator ecosystem. CEO Sanidhya Narain highlighted the goal of delivering seamless storytelling through AI, tackling challenges like character consistency. Beyond consumer apps, Dashverse also offers AI-powered tools to help creators produce serialised content, aiming to democratise content creation via a thriving two-sided marketplace.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Tue, 12 Aug 2025 21:36:57 +0530]]></pubDate>
      <dc:creator>Swapnil Deshpande</dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/startup/dashverse-series-a-funding-ai-powered-tools-dashreels-creator-ecosystem-india-19652864.htm]]></guid>
      <category><![CDATA[Business]]></category>
      <media:content height="675" width="1200" medium="image" url="https://images.cnbctv18.com/uploads/2021/08/startup_funding1.jpg"/>
    </item>

      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/market/earnings/poly-medicure-q1-fy26-earnings-revenue-slowdown-guidance-19652074.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Poly Medicure has revised its FY26 revenue growth guidance to around 16%, down from an earlier estimate of 20%, citing a weak June quarter impacted by slower performance in Europe. While the domestic business continues to show robust growth at about 30%, the export segment’s growth target has been lowered to 5–10%. Despite challenges, the company expects margins to remain comfortable at 26–27%. In Q1 FY26, Poly Medicure posted a 4.8% rise in revenue and a 25.7% jump in profit after tax.]]></description>
